After restart for update VSCode keeps crashing. "Window is crashed, you can reopen it..."
I deleted VSCode from applications directory and redownloaded it, issue still there

data.title: Introduce a window.title relative path variable for the folder of a file
data.body:
I'd like to request two new variables to output `myProject/myFolder` or `myFolder`.  The goal is for `window.title` to produce the string: `myFile.txt - myProject/myFolder - Visual Studio Code`.  I'd like to be able to see `myFolder` in the window title, but not before `myFile.txt`.  This is because sometimes `${activeEditorMedium}` is long enough to obscure the actual filename.

The default example is doesn't really show why this would be useful, a better example is if you are editing `vscode/src/vs/platform/actions/browser/menuItemActionItem.ts`.  I want to see the relative path of the active file in the window title, but `menuItemActionItem.ts` should be visible from the taskbar.

data.title: Hangs while scrolling

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
I am using Visual Studio Code v1.10.2. Scrolling is not smooth for the files. I have a PHP file of roughly 300 lines. If I scroll it will stop at the point where I started scrolling skip most the scroll and then almost reach the endpoint of the scroll and scroll till the endpoint. I hope you got me. I will try to get a video of this.

But If I have to update any extension, after updating the extension it will give me option to reload the window. If I reload the window, this problem will be gone and it will scroll smoothly even If I close the window and reopen it.

I hope I was clear. Let me know if I can help you with any more information.

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version:Microsoft Windows 10 Home Single Language

data.title: Test: maximize / restore panel size
data.body:
- [x] any os - @gregvanl Windows 10
- [x] any os - @egamma 

Complexity: 1

As per #22135 we have polished how a user can maximize / restore the panel size.
Open the panel and verify:
* You now have a maximize / restore action in the panel title bar which always visually reflects what the action will do
* The action properly maximizes the panel or reduces the panel height to its previous value
* You can still drag the panel to maximum height and the action will nicely update and behave properly

data.title: Cursor lags behind input
data.body:
Since the newest update of VS Code the cursor sometimes lags behind when typing. This means that when I type e.g `abcdef`, the cursor is sometimes not behind, but before the `f`. This is extremely annoying.

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Pro v1607

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Type something
2. Notice cursor lagging behind on some inputs

Could it be caused by a plugin?

Debug console in the bottom is such an overkill, especially on wide screens with high resolution.
It would be a world changer to be able to configure it's positioning.

data.title: code cannot start with AFS homedir

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2 (code_1.10.2-1488981323_amd64.deb)
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04 LTS

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Have home directory w/ `.config` on AFS.
2. Run `code --verbose`.
3. Get the following error:
```
Error: listen EPERM /home/l/lars/.config/Code/1.10.2-main.sock
    at Object.exports._errnoException (util.js:1026:11)
    at exports._exceptionWithHostPort (util.js:1049:20)
    at Server._listen2 (net.js:1240:19)
    at listen (net.js:1289:10)
    at Server.listen (net.js:1378:5)
    at /usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:7:11235
    at new n.Class.derive._oncancel (/usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:6:13143)
    at Object.p [as serve] (/usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:7:11165)
    at o (/usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:13:9918)
    at te (/usr/share/code/resources/app/out/vs/code/electron-main/main.js:13:10989)
```

Code starts normally if moving the `.config/Code` directory to a local filesystem and symlinking it in. I would reckon that it's probably not portable to put the kind of thing that `1.10.2-main.sock` is in the homedir, as it may very well be mounted in fun ways or on network filesystems.

This behaviour is new since the previous release I ran, which I believe was `code_1.9.1-1486597190_amd64.deb`.

data.title: Support "Report Issue" for individual extensions

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
Today the inbox tracker has to move many issues to different repositories even if it was clear for the creator of the issue that it was an issue with a specific extension.

One reason for this is that the "Report Issue" action makes it very easy to create an issue against VS Code but not against any other repository.

It would be extremely helpful if we could support extension specific "Report Issue" (may be as sub menus under "Report Issue").

data.title: tasks.json task should quote the command string

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Windows 10 Anniversary

**This doesn't work:**

```json
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "%ProgramFiles%/nodejs/node.exe",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "args": [ "--version" ],
    "showOutput": "always"
}
```

Output:
```
'C:\Program' is not recognized as an internal or external command,
operable program or batch file.
```

**But this works:**

```json
{
    "version": "0.1.0",
    "command": "C:/Program Files/nodejs/node.exe",
    "isShellCommand": true,
    "args": [ "--version" ],
    "showOutput": "always"
}
```
Output:
```
v7.7.0
```

To my understanding VS Code wraps the command string into quotes only if there're spaces.
But it misses the situation when an environment variable may evaluate to a string with spaces.

This related to *cmd.exe*, didn't test with *bash*.

data.title: Feature request: add padding when pressing space between a pair of curly braces

milestone.title: Backlog
milestone.description: Work not yet planned for a specific release.

data.body:
When I type `{` to create a pair of curly braces:
```
{}
```
...and then when I press space, I would like 2 spaces to be inserted with the cursor in the middle:
```
{ | }
  ^ cursor
```
Currently it just inserts a single space, so getting the same result requires pressing space twice then the back arrow once. Or otherwise setting:
```
"javascript.format.insertSpaceAfterOpeningAndBeforeClosingNonemptyBrackets": true
// or "typescript.format.insertSpaceAfterOpeningAndBeforeClosingNonemptyBrackets": true
```
...then formatting the line once there's already stuff inside it.

I believe pressing space between a pair of brackets with nothing between them (`{}`) is more-or-less an unambiguous signal (in pretty much any language) that the user intends to have a padding space at both ends. It's also very similar to the already-covered case where someone instead presses enter to produce:
```
{
  | <- cursor
}
```

In Sublime Text I was able to add the functionality myself using a keybinding that looked (in their format) like:
```
{ "keys": ["space"], "command": "insert_snippet", "args": {"contents": " $0 "}, "context":
  [
    { "key": "selection_empty", "operator": "equal", "operand": true, "match_all": true },
    { "key": "preceding_text", "operator": "regex_contains", "operand": "\\{$", "match_all": true },
    { "key": "following_text", "operator": "regex_contains", "operand": "^\\}", "match_all": true }
  ]
}
```
...but in VS Code there doesn't seem to be enough functionality available to add a keybinding like this - I can insert a snippet but can't see anything that would allow me to limit the context to the inside of a pair of brackets.

If someone points me to the place in the codebase where the similar behavior for pressing "enter" is defined, I might be able to open a PR myself.

data.title: Question: Can you search all instances of console.log and then comment them all out at once?
data.body:

From what I searched they were about highlighting (knowing where) the particular lines and then commenting out. So say for JavaScript I want to comment out all the console.logs at once to clean up console log. Is there a feature where I can pull up ctrl+f 'find' and search for 'console.log' then hit a button 'comment out' or something? Where it would comment out all lines of 'console.log' wherever they may be in a file?

data.title: Shift + Delete supposedly delete the line
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.1
- OS Version: Windows 7

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Just pick any line
2. press ctrl + x without any selection
3. line will gone
4. press ctrl + v
5. the "cut" line will be pasted
(this is correct)

1. Just pick any line
2. press shift + delete without any selection
3. line will gone
4. press ctrl + v
5. the "cut" line will be pasted
(this is wrong!)

Shift + Delete supposedly delete the whole line, but not replacing the current clipboard with the deleted line.

data.title: Invocation of the function let add a b = a + b does not work on debug console
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode -->

- VSCode Version: 1.10.2
- OS Version: Ubuntu 16.04

Steps to Reproduce:

1.create new F# project
2. On the main file paste
let sub (a, b) = a - b
let add a b =
    a + b
3. place a breakpoint debug on the first line of the main and hit start debugging
4. enter (add 2 3) on debug console to be executed on the context which returns
 error CS1026: ) expected

Interestingly when the parameter is constrained by a tuple like on sub it works:
sub (3, 2)
1

Also tested the add function on fsharpi from mono and it worked there.

Thanks for opening such a great language with a very respectable inheritance for non windows users.

Geraldo Lopes de Souza

data.title: 编辑器上下布局的时候，两组编辑器的代码莫名其妙的交换，请见详情。
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.10.2 (8076a19fdcab7e1fc1707952d652f0bb6c6db331, 2017-03-08T14:02:52.799Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT ia32 10.0.14393
- Extensions: 

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|html-snippets|abusaidm|0.1.0|
|calculate|acarreiro|1.1.0|
|project-manager|alefragnani|0.13.4|
|path-intellisense|christian-kohler|1.2.0|
|gitignore|codezombiech|0.5.0|
|vscode-markdownlint|DavidAnson|0.7.0|
|javadebugger|donjayamanne|0.0.2|
|java-debug|DSnake|0.0.2|
|javac-linter|faustinoaq|1.2.2|
|url-encode|flesler|1.1.0|
|rest-client|humao|0.12.3|
|guid|kosunix|0.0.1|
|vscode-JS-CSS-HTML-formatter|lonefy|0.2.2|
|markdown-shortcuts|mdickin|0.7.1|

|csharp|ms-vscode|1.8.0|
|java|redhat|0.0.11|
|vscode-icons|robertohuertasm|7.3.0|

|markdown-pdf|yzane|0.1.6|;


---

Steps to Reproduce:

1.编辑器上下布局，在上面双击某个单词。
2.在下面单击某处，上面和下面代码会莫名其妙的互换，毫无规律。
